website_summaries.verdict: Dries without creating frizz, even in the most humid climates.
pros: Tourmaline titanium technology creates incredible shine
Far-infrared allows  faster drying and styling
Rubberized finish handle which provides a comfortable grip
Six heat and speed settings, with cold shot
cons: Control buttons are easy to hit accidentally while drying
Red finish eventually degrades for some

customer_reviews.title: One dishonest company
customer_reviews.text: One dishonest company that refused to honor their warranty policy. We bought it less than 2 years ago (in 2015) and now it's overheating the second it's plugged in. My wife called and gave them the serial number. Their support told my wife it's out of warranty because the serial number dated back to 2013. Really??!?!?!? You shipped us an outdated merchandise to begin with and now you tell us it is no longer under warranty when we had a 3 year warranty on the product.
customer_reviews.author: mkwok

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the RED!
customer_reviews.text: Almost 5 years into having this dryer and it still functions perfectly fine, but I wanted people to know that the red on the dryer has gotten everywhere in my bathroom and it looks nothing like this anymore. Perhaps the red coating cannot handle long periods of drying? In any event, it looks awful and can rub off on your wood bathroom drawers. I think I need to replace it just for my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: JSwil

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY this garbage. Three dryers in 4 and a half years, all broke.
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned this item three times. First, in 2013, died in February, 2016. Bought a second one in February, 2016, it died in December, 2016. Then I called Conair, the maker of the product, and they replaced it under the two year warranty. It just sparked and blew up on me this morning, and Conair tells me that the replacement is only warrantied from February, 2016 on even though this one lasted only 15 months. Cheaply made, quick to break.
customer_reviews.author: Dani R.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 2 years with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Babyliss Pro Tourmaline Titanium 3000 Dryer 3/2016; bet I haven't used it 75 times. I blow my hair for about 10 -13 mins. Today it got very hot and shut off.12 hours later it still won't work, I can hear a very low hum but that is it. Pushing the reset button did nothing. The price has gone up from $56.91 to $79.99. Definitely will NOT purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: picky buyer

customer_reviews.title: worked well while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I did not have any issue with paint coming off or anything else and the dryer worked very well. However, it did have very short life span of 1 year or so and I had to buy a new one after it stopped working so I would not recommend this product as a dryer at this price should be built to last more years in my opinion. Our family did use this dryer every day for just over a year and it worked well while it lasted but not sure why it died and stopped working after just 1 year...
customer_reviews.author: DavidsList 📝👍💬✅

customer_reviews.title: Been over 5 years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the paint faded. The paint did not come off like the pictures of the other purchasers did. It just faded. But my dryer is still performing just like the day I bought it. I dropped it a couple of years ago and the outer screen on the back broke off but the screen that is an integral part of the dryer is still fine. I'd buy it again. And will if and when this one finally dies. Use it about 2-3 times a week to dry my medium thickness hair and daily to heat up my eyelash curler.
customer_reviews.author: C Brown

customer_reviews.title: Completely ruined my hair
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get this dryer on Amazon, but I felt it was important to leave a review here, as I know it's the first place I go for reviews, no matter where I'm making my purchase. I have been using this hair dryer for a few years. I did really like it because it gets extremely hot and dries hair fast. The problem is it's TOO hot. If you are using it to straighten curly hair, and applying the heat directly on your hair all the time, it will burn your hair. It turned my beautiful, nourished, curly hair into a dry, brittle mess. I am throwing this dryer away and would never recommend it for direct, daily/repeated use.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Tight About This Titanium 3000
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be more pissed. This is my second one. I loved the way it dried by hair, but the concentrator doesn’t stay on. The first time around, I thought it was somehow my fault. I bought a second blow dryer—because I believe there’s good in the world—and it happened again. After a couple of months, the concentrator loses the strength to stay on and I lose my will to live. A slight tap will send the thing flying across the room like a prom dress. Don’t waste your dollars on this Baby-steal-my-bliss-PRO.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: After going through reviews and having trouble with my hair getting snarled while blow drying i went ahead and splurged on this model. Am super disappointed that after 6 months of use 3-4 times a week it has a short on the one-off switch and no longer turns on consistently. Unfortunately i don’t have the box or information anymore so am just stuck with having spent $80 on a hairdryer that isn’t worth the money. I have the same luck with the snarls with a less expensive dryer that actually worked consistently for 5 years
customer_reviews.author: John Buhrmann

customer_reviews.title: Caught on fire!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this hair dryer as a gift 2 years ago. 7 months in...it caught on fire. I repurchased it because I really liked how fast it dried my hair and thought maybe I had a defective one. Yesterday, 9 months later, my second one caught on fire. So upset!!
customer_reviews.author: krysty

customer_reviews.title: Best blow dryer I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and I used it and I absolutely love it! One of the best blow dryers I've ever invested in. The seller actually got it to me one day early. I have a Chi hair straightener that was $100 and I almost don't even need it anymore because this blow dryer is that good! I have very frizzy hair and this doesn't fry or phrase my hair
customer_reviews.author: george pierson

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but coating is peeling off.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this blow dryer for 5 months and the coating on the handle is crackling and now peeling off. I'm starting to see little red pieces all over my hands and my bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen W.

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted for 7 years and still running
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hair dryer in 2011 and I am still using it! I have shoulder length hair and use it every day, it dries my in 5-10 minutes . My daughter has long, thick hair and she swears she can dry her hair in half the time with my dryer rather than hers. The color has faded on the handle but it is not chipping and is in otherwise great shape despite the many drops on the tile floor over the years. When it quits, I will buy another from BaByliss!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya T

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true
customer_reviews.text: Guys, I'm writing this 7 years after purchasing this blow dryer. It still works! The red color is rubbing off, and it looks like it's been tossed around in a suitcase a couple of times, but overall this ruby gem is still going strong. I recommend it if you're looking for a work horse. Not small nor particularly lightweight but a hardy appliance all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Dykhuis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Blow Dryer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this blow dryer and combined with the diffuser, dries my hair quickly and without any frizzing. The diffuser helps volumize my hair when drying from below while scrunching it. It is worth repeating a line from another review I read, I didn't realize the type of blow dryer made a difference in how my hair comes out. I thought it was the hair products but it definitely is the combination of both. This is an excellent dryer and one of the best I've ever had. I have very fine, straight hair and have had a great hair day every day since I bought this about a month ago. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: LINDA R.

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking but disappointed with its function.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the best thing about this dryer is the way it looks. In order to dry my hair quickly like I had purchased at for, I would have to use it with the attachment and on the highest heat setting. But then it would not only burn my scalp but the dryer itself gets a bit hot, making holding it too long, uncomfortable. Also when I would hold it, because of where the buttons are placed, I would change the setting or turn it off by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: MsMoHes

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love my new blow dryer! My old blow dryer had been limping along - I think I was going on year 10. I finally broke down and got this one per my hair stylists suggestion - this is the one she uses at home as well. The only thing I am still getting used to about this blow dryer is that the "hot" setting is far too hot, uncomfortably hot, for my scalp. I wish there was a setting between "warm" and "hot." There are three settings - cool, warm, hot. Other than that, this blow dryer gets 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dryer...poor exterior
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 3 years. I have thick, wavy hair and it's done a great job smoothing it out for the most part where cheap dryers have failed. Only one star b/c like many reviews, the diffuser pops off easily. Also, the filter on the back broke over time. Three Cheap plastic prongs hold it on. Without it, it doesn't perform as well and it is much louder. Having to buy something else a lot sooner than planned when I paid so much for this one is a big disappointment. Hate to replace it when dryer part itself is still fine. Also, plastic on handle is breaking off too...again with gentle use over time.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Great hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hair dryer. It gets very hot (which I like) and dries my hair well. I have thick, somewhat wavy hair. I bought it July 2016 and the fan just stopped working this week (Oct 2019). I guess that’s pretty good considering I use it every day. I’m most disappointed that I need to buy another one and it’s not on sale this time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash. The paint came off on EVERYTHING next ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute trash. The paint came off on EVERYTHING next to it (see pictures). I had to throw away several items, along with this demon dryer to keep the sticky red mess from spreading. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Steinbeck

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A stylist I had used this brand, I was excited to get one. But after a couple of months using it, the vent cover wouldn't stay on well, it kept falling off and there were only three prongs to attach it, which two broke because of falling off. The switch placement isn't ideal because I bump them accidentally while blow drying. The flow and power is decent. But I haven't found a way to replace the vent cover. Sadly I'm trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: sun-kissed_yogi

customer_reviews.title: Much quieter than most dryers for the same performance.
customer_reviews.text: The dryer is wonderful. It's far quieter than something you might pick up in a department store. In fact the sound that it creates is so much lower that it leaves you with the impression that it's not blowing as hard as cheaper dryers. It's actually doing quite a job. It's very nice, but it should be. Certainly at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: CiCi

customer_reviews.title: Oof. Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: It’s true what everyone is saying! I have loved the power of this blow dryer but since I bought it the red has been coming off. You can’t travel with it - mine has ruined bags, stained clothes, countertops and even the door to our bathroom. It just transfers everywhere. They need to fix this!
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good hairdryer with a couple of issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hairdryer with a couple of issues. The diffuser has never worked properly and pops off easily. I eventually have given up trying to use it because it's so frustrating. The back filter cover is also cheap plastic with tiny prongs to hold it into place. They've all snapped off so I have tape holding the filter in place which isn't ideal. As others have mentioned, the paint color does chip too but that doesn't effect how the hairdryer functions. This hairdryer is powerful though which is why I like it. I have fine hair (but a lot of it) and it takes forever to dry so this is a good option if you have similar hair.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: fine, curly
customer_reviews.text: fine,curly, grey, colored hair. 50 yrs old with changing textured hair. dryes fast. now i dont have so much damage. i used a 7 yr old target one and my stylst said no way. i bought it so now with, a water filter on shower head, this blow dryer, Cricket Centrix Alumilite Round Thermal Brush, 65mm , Matrix Biolage Keratindose Pro-Keratin Plus...or joico my hair is in the best cond. ever! this is heasy to hold, turn, flex, the button is in a odd place for heat levels often i turn it cool warm but its ok. im gettig used to it. love it so much!!!!!!!!!!!amazing quality and now my hair will be smoother less dried out and frizzy.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: The color slowing melts over time!  Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: The red paint on the outside melts and gets on everything. It happens slowly for at first you don't understand why your hands are a bit read and your sink, etc. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: A Johansson

customer_reviews.title: great hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: this is the most powerful hair dryer I have ever used and it feels so good on your scalp. I want to keep drying my hair even after its dried. love it
customer_reviews.author: Fun2read

customer_reviews.title: My girlfriend loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girlfriend because she needed a new hairdryer. After she started using it, she noticed that it dries her hair more evenly and quickly. The air heats up quickly, and the motor is strong. Overall, it has been great and helps her get ready faster than she used too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Light in Weight but packs the HEAT!
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a babyliss because I dropped it too many times. It actually still works but the piece that made it click to high broke. That one was heavy but awesome. This one is light in weight and does all that the older heavy model did. I especially appreciate the coating on it that keeps it slip free. Probably why my other model got dropped. It didn't have this rubbery type coating on it. The Cord!!!! LONG! So I can actually nearly walk to the kitchen while drying my hair! Excellent and wouldn't own any other brand of hair dryer. No frizzies with this either! Superb product. I'd recommend this baby!
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good value, very light and leaves my hair less frizzy and straighter
customer_reviews.text: Good product. This is my 3rd hair dryer from this company and I have never been dissatisfied. Themis blow dryer is light and dries my hip length hair within 7 minutes. My hair comes out less frizzy and straighter . Also some people have said that the red dye rubs off, I have not had that issue within the four months that I’ve had this product .
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sweder

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Annoying
customer_reviews.text: I’m so annoyed with this purchase but I already used it and can’t return it. It’s heavy and takes forever to dry my hair. Also the switch is right where you hold it so I am constantly switching it off accidentally. Dont buy this ugh I’m so annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: so I broke down an purchased another just like it - hopefully
customer_reviews.text: The filter did not stay on well, so as a result of it falling off the tabs all broke off. Although I tried to hold the filter on as I dried my hair, it still developed a burning smell so I had to replace it for fear that it would start on fire. A previous dryer that I purchased from this company actually did start on fire! You cannot beat the output which results in a huge decrease in drying time though, so I broke down an purchased another just like it - hopefully, the third time will be the charm!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: I used my Mom's and like it. So I bought one. A bit expensive, but it seems sturdy. 4 stars because the on/off buttons are placed so I some times accidentally turn the hairdryer off or to a different setting. The cool button is conveniently placed. Plenty power to dry my short hair in 30 seconds with my head upside down. Then about 2 more minutes to style using the cool button. I can recommend this hair dryer.
customer_reviews.author: V. A. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great Hair Dryer
customer_reviews.text: Never did I think there was a difference with hair dryers I was wrong. This is a great hair dryer. Only problem: my 85 year old mother tried it - loved it and it is now in her possession
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Red Babyliss
customer_reviews.text: This dryer is one my favorites, the red color is beautiful and elegant and matches with my straightener and Revlon paddle brush. I initially bought this because it matched my straightener, but its even better than I anticipated. Its very light when I'm drying my hair and doesn't leave a strain in my wrist. As well as it cuts my drying time by a fraction and leaves my hair feeling silky and smooth with a fluffy finish which I love. I've had this drying now 5 years and still working great
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: Color Bleeds off
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited how light and quiet this dryer was. Huge disappointment is the red color bleeds and rubs off onto your hands and anything else if you have any water or product on your hands. I only found out when my white towels had pink/red marks on them. I normally put some moose in my hair before blowing it dry. I wipe excess moose off my hands but it's not enough I have to make sure my hands are completely dry before touching the dryer or else I have pink/red hands after using it. I literally have to scrub my hands clean before touching anything else. Such a let down. Searching for a new dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Urbanie

customer_reviews.title: This was a great little blowdryer until about 4 months into using it
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little blowdryer until about 4 months into using it, the low setting on the blower stopped working---it only blows on high now which can be a little overwhelming since it is a powerful hairdryer. It dries my hair quickly though, is very light (so much less strain on the arms) and the long cord is very convenient. After I bought mine, I realized that the salon I use has them at every station! My stylist is also a big fan of these dryers, so there's a professional's opinion as well. I also love the red color!
customer_reviews.author: EdTheTalkingHorse

customer_reviews.title: and had a great fitting nozzle which I really like
customer_reviews.text: This blow dryer is drying to the hair. The design seems to zap moisture from my hair. I usually blowdry on low with this dtyer, which does the job and is less drying than the high speed, but takes more time. There really should be a medium speed but there isn't. This dryer has two options... Slow burn and fast burn. The pluses atr that it is lightweight, and had a great fitting nozzle which I really like. I hate when the nozzles fall off likey previous blow dryer. Good luck with yours. Maybe the high temp will be OK for some.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough and warm is too hot
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as strong as the MegaTurbo 2500/3000. And the warm is hot and hot is even hotter. To me, not good for barber use. I need powerful air to quickly dry and shape shorter hairstyles, as well as to blow hair on the floor quickly and easily from against the station to away from my chair where it can be swept away more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Barber Rich

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 7 years!
customer_reviews.text: I had this hair dryer for 7 years and love it. All of the sudden the paint started coming off of it. My hands would be red after using it and the paint started getting on the counter, etc so I got rid of it and got a new one. The new one Babyliss Nano Pro - it’s blue- dries even faster!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous! Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, lightweight and quiet. I am very pleased. No frizz, no burning, easy to clean the lint trap. Worth the money. After a lifetime of heavy, awkward and loud Conairs and Revlons, etc, I spent a few more dollars and got my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: Floradora207

customer_reviews.title: Great for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: The switch on my old dryer broke so I thought I'd try this one out since it had such great reviews. I didn't really think a dryer could be the difference maker for frizzy hair, but it is! My old dryer supposedly had the titanium technology, but it always left my fine hair super frizzy - and this was after a pre-blow dry serum and a post-blow dry dose of Moroccan oil. This dryer seems to dry my hair a bit more quickly and leave it a little straighter. I wish it had a retractable cord as the cord is insanely long for my 1 foot reach to the outlet, but it's not enough to subtract a star.
customer_reviews.author: BersReview

customer_reviews.title: Great dryer.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered this dryer because it was advertised as lightweight. I'm very happy with it. It is lightweight and compact in size. I also like that it has high/lo and cool/warm/hot settings and that the nozzle snaps on tightly and doesn't swivel while I'm using the dryer. Other reviewers have mentioned that they keep hitting the switches while using the dryer and I am experiencing that as well. I think that as I get more used to the dryer, that will happen less. I'm planning to donate my travel dryers because I think this one is almost a travel size and has more power. I'll be packing this one from now on. I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne S

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second after the death of my first
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this model. I did so after my original had the back filter break off and kept shutting off and not turning back on. My first one lasted 7 years. With my thick, curly, long hair, I can short out a dryer in less than one month. I don't have the problem of it smelling like a bonfire either. Love it. Just wish there was a diffuser that fits.
customer_reviews.author: Zxe1103

customer_reviews.title: Good for thinning hair
customer_reviews.text: I really like how the dryer works. My hair is very soft, however had to go with the 4 stars because the red is wearing off on the mat in the bathroom cabinet. I purchased this model for the infrared because of my hair loss.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are true!! The ions are magical!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hair dryer!! At first I was really put off by the price and all the glowing reviews claiming that the "ions" are magical, etc BUT THEY ARE TRUE! I have type 2b wavy hair (aka incredibly frizzy and not quite curly or straight) and this dryer + the matching diffuserhas made SUCH A BIG DIFFERENCE FOR FRIZZ :-D If you are at all on the fence about this (and have the money to spare!) go for it and try it for yourself, Amazon has a great return policy but I doubt you'll want to send it back once you try it for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: StackSquared

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one in 7 years to blow out!!!
customer_reviews.text: On hold with Babyliss Pro for 27 minutes with a phone call that lasted 47 minutes. Website page stated a 3 year warranty but Babyliss insists it's only a 2 year warranty. Deceitful company is all I can say based on this experience. So not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: and after 4 years of daily use I want to say this is one of the best dryers you can buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this dryer since 2012, and after 4 years of daily use I want to say this is one of the best dryers you can buy for the money. The good: powerful, hot, dries hair quickly. The bad: dropped the dryer a couple of times and the rear filter element piece broke. I called Conair and tried to get a replacement but they didn't offer it at all. The paint will peel pretty quickly and looks horrible after a while, but who cares how it looks if it works! It's still going strong and I'm planning to get another.
customer_reviews.author: Casual Surfer

customer_reviews.title: Love this dryer, the best
customer_reviews.text: I love this dryer. Dries my hair very soft and smooth without damage. It has held up well for 3 years. I bought one to keep at my boyfriends house too. It doesn’t make a loud sound which I like. The only downside is the red color starts to slowly fade overtime, but for me I don’t mind because it works so well. I didn’t have the issue other reviewers talked about the hand placement and buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Red dye melts everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This blow dryer works great except the red coating stains your hands and bathroom counter tops as you blow out your hair. Whatever BaByliss used for the red finishing is so cheap it melts all over your hands making this a nuasance.
customer_reviews.author: marilu rivas

customer_reviews.title: hair dryer, works well.
customer_reviews.text: what can i say? my previous hairdryer had been in use (*very* sporadically) for nearly 30 years. I figured it was time to retire it before I electrocuted myself. This one isn’t too heavy, fits well in the hand, is a nice color, and seems to do the job of drying my hair without scorching it to death. I don’t plan to use it for 30 years, but it would be nice if it lasted for at least 10?
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Best Hairdryer I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I first used a Babyliss hairdryer on a cruise ship and was wowed by its quality and functionality. I wanted one for myself and found the Babyliss Pro Tourmaline Titanium 3000 Dryer on Amazon.com (different model than the cruise ship had). It is BY FAR the best hairdryer I've ever owned. I love the balanced weight, the temperature and blower settings, and its relative quietness. While my old dryer only offered only searing heat or overly cool air, the Babyliss has cool, warm, and hot settings that are accurate. The blower has two options: low and high and they both work on all heat settings. This hair dryer is expensive, but worth it, especially considering how often it's used.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Coddington

customer_reviews.title: Functional and pretty dryer :)
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for almost a year now and it still works great! I have yet to buy the diffuser attachment but have often thought it would be a nice addition to my routine. This thing dries my very long thick, curly hair in about 10 minutes. That's 15 less than how long it took my old dryer. I usually just air dry my hair since I don't mind looking like a ragamuffin 90% of the time, but I use this paired with my big round brush, a few drops of Paul Mitchell Super Skinny Serum ( and a hair protecting mist anytime I want to look fabulous for a special occasion. :)
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: The BEST dryer you can get!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dryer I've ever got to use. It's more powerful than most of those I've seen in stores. You don't have to use high temperature and overheat your hair to get a nice style. It saves a lot of time for me in the morning. It has a long cord which is perfect for a tall girl like myself (5"8 and fabulous) when drying your hair standing. The downside is that the paint scratches very easily. It's time for anew one and I will look into a black color this time.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Best dryer ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had this dryer for 9 years- perfect silky hair every time I used it. I literally thought “I must just have good hair”. So the motor just started going out, so I decided to buy one of those “mint green celebrity” hair dryers. My hair was frizzy and terrible! Gave it to a friend and re-bought my BabyBliss! Best dryer ever!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great Hair Dryer
customer_reviews.text: This hairdryer is very lightweight and very QUIET compared to most. The HOT setting is VERY HOT and can burn your hair and scalp if not careful. I use this setting in the very beginning of my drying when my hair is soaking wet. I then switch to WARM and then to COLD to finalize my style. The drying time is drastically faster with this dryer then ANY (and I do mean ANY) other hair dryer I have ever used. I highly recommend it, but definately want people to realize that the HOT setting is not the setting you would use it on the entire time your drying your hair.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garza

customer_reviews.title: it was working excelent, until last week keeps turning off while using ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dryer 1 year 1/2 ago, it was working excelent, until last week keeps turning off while using it, I thought it was the plug that couldn't handle the heat, but no, it is the hair dryer. Unfortunately, cannot use it anymore and disappointed because it last too soon. The hair dryer is great, my hair was shining, straight and great styles. I wish it could last longer to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Liliana Garcia

customer_reviews.title: This ones a gem !
customer_reviews.text: My dryer finally died and I needed a replacement. Went with a baby bliss as I had one prior. I chose this one for it’s smoothing and frizz resistance feature . When summer comes it will truly be put to the test but so far it’s left my hair tamed . They don’t disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: This hair dryer is great, small, light weight but extremely powerful. The settings help to dry hair quickly without damaging your hair. The cool and warm setting helps to cool your hair and alleviate frizz. It is a great hairdryer, I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P.

customer_reviews.title: Air intake cover is broken on two of these dryers.  Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.text: A year after purchasing this very expensive hair dryer, the air intake cover has broken teeth. The cover won't stay on. My daughter bought the exact same hair dryer a couple of months before I did, and hers did the same thing...about two months before mine did, suggesting to me a design flaw. Our need is simple: TWO replacement air intake covers, so that we may each replace the broken ones on our dryers.
customer_reviews.author: Amy R

customer_reviews.title: A great hair dryer for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this hair dryer. I have really long & thick hair and it dries quickly. Easy to operate and handle. I highly recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Hesitantly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'm torn on this dryer. On one hand, it gets the job done, on the other, it gets really, really, excessively hot, more like a cheapy dryer might. I paid I think around $70/$80 for it, but now that the price has dropped to less than $50, I'd say that's a more accurate price for what you get. It dries, it doesn't take TOO long, and the current price point I think is a good deal for it. I've only had a few issues with the buttons, mostly when I'm distracted and doing too many things at once, but it's just a hair dryer so it's not like flipping the wrong button for a few seconds is a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey D.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hair dryer. I initially bought it for my daughter earlier this year and she loved it. My dryer stopped working recently so I borrowed my daughter's one day. I liked it so much I bought one for myself! It dries really quickly relative to other hair dryers I've owned. My only complaint is that the metallic red paint chips off very easily. In fact, it was already chipped a bit when I took it out of the packaging. Otherwise, it's great! It has a nice long cord that gives me plenty of room to reach to my mirror.
customer_reviews.author: J. AdamTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a few weeks, solid blow dryer. Feels well made, the rocker buttons feel like industrial grade, not cheap plastic. Cord is really long, almost longer than I need, but hey doesn't hurt. No funny smells when I first used it. Handle is easy enough to hold without pressing any of the buttons on accident. Going to buy the travel edition because I like this one so much.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: for
customer_reviews.text: the price it's pretty good. I find the nozzle attachment falls off easily and that is very frustrating as it's brand new. I maybe should have paid a bit more and got a higher end dryer as I blow dry every other day with a round brush and those are the only tools I use on my hair for the most part hence the 3 stars vs. 5. Definitely dries faster than my old dryer, but I use the nozzle attachment ALWAYS so it's a bit disappointing and frustrating that it pops off so easily.
customer_reviews.author: TravelerTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, powerful, and dries hair FAST!
customer_reviews.text: I've used many hair dryers in the past but was in the market for the most efficient, least harsh on my long hair. I've recently grown out my hair to about the middle of my back and the drying time with my old hair dryer took 20 minutes. This one easily cut more than half off the drying time. I've never been able to use diffusers/attachments in the past because they never fit correctly and ended up flying off during use, but this one fits just right. The dryer heat get super hot but it's not frying my hair. It's actually keeping it nice and silky. Definitely throw out your ratty hair dryers...this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Calamity_Cat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: This hair dryer is light weight and powerful. It is a bit big for traveling but with the coronavirus I don't think I will be traveling anywhere for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Shifrin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1.5 years, on fire
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2019, now in Oct 2020 it is toast. First blow dryer I've purchased at a higher price, wanted a good one, now back to the 5 year old cheap $20 dryer that is still working. Mind you this year and half of use was during covid during which time I rarely used. Supremely disappointed. Fire inside started this morning with it. Never write reviews but had to be shared.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More volume but less shine compared to ceramic dryer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old ceramic blow dryer. I have thick, wavy, long hair. With this dryer I get much more volume at the roots than I used to with my old ceramic dryer, and I don't get fly-aways with this dryer. Yay! However, I don't get the shine I used to get from my ceramic dryer -- instead, my hair's texture is matte and soft. As noted by other reviewers, your hair will not be "silky" after using one of these dryers. I think the trade off is fine for the winter when I don't have to deal with humidity, but in the summer I might go back to ceramic.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad deal
customer_reviews.text: Blow dryer left my thick hair smooth and shiny. However, the nozzle kept falling off from day 1, which was ultra annoying (I had to duck-tape it on). The hair filter also fell off and needed to be attached with tape (this proved to be a pain when it was time to clean the filter). This model lasted me 4 years, which is not bad for a blow dryer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with it! I never bothered spending good money on a good hairdryer before and I am sorry I never did. I am a latina and I relax my thick tight curls. I have lots of hair up to my shoulders, so it used to take me over an hour to dry it. And after all that my hair would come out dry and brittle. But with this hairdryer, it takes me less than 30 minutes!! But better than that my hair comes out shinny and manageable. I first make sure my hair is dry or semy dry before I do a blow out.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, compact, easy to adjust and control, QUIET, does not over-dry or cause static.  The One!
customer_reviews.text: This particular model of BaByliss electric hair dryer is "the one." Relatively lightweight, compact, QUIET, and easy to adjust and hold for excellent control. We purchased a second one because the first impressed so much with ease of control, and did I say quiet? Does not over-dry or cause static. This is a great value as a long-term investment in a tool that gets used daily, and will far outlast the value brands that we have purchased many times over in the past. No more of that, this is "it." Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: bobbyg53

customer_reviews.title: Poor airspeed
customer_reviews.text: This dryer performed no better than a dryer half the price. Despite the good watts, the airflow was average on the High setting and the concentrator nozzle opening was nearly an inch less than my previous dryer, a Sedu. I have shoulder length, naturally wavy hair that I blow into a straight bob. It took longer, had some frizz and didn't add shine. I'm returning it and getting another Sedu, despite the higher price. If you've used a professional, salon quality dryer before, you will not be satisfied with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Babyliss dryer
customer_reviews.text: I like this dryer and the feel of it. The body seems a little sturdier than previous dryers and it's a little more compact. Although, you can switch settings while you are drying your hair very easily as the toggles are right at your finger tips as you are drying; unfortunately, it can be annoying. Time will tell if it lasts longer than other dryers. Cleaning the filter is easy. Update: the plastic attachment tabs on the round disk-like filter on the back of the dryer broke off. It protects the fan from dust and hair. I will not buy dryers from this company again. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CMach

customer_reviews.title: Dries your hair in six seconds flat
customer_reviews.text: Okay, maybe not six seconds, but this hair dryer is perfect for someone who needs hair dried in a hurry. The only thing I noticed is that I get more curl in the hair with this dryer. I assume it has something to do with the rapid drying. So if you want curl and rapid drying, this one is for you. It is light and compact. It's probably not the best for someone who wants a very smooth, flat finish to their hair as you will probably make up for the time drying in time trying to straighten your hair. Still a good purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: I love this blow dryer
customer_reviews.text: I love this blow dryer! I have naturally wavy, thick hair and I rarely straighten it because after blow drying it usually looks fried. I've had this dryer for a few months now and can say that I love the way it works. My blowouts take less time and my hair is smoother than with any dryers I've tried before. Previous reviews noted the buttons are in a location that cause you to hit them- I have accidentally turned it off a couple of times, but you do get used to it, and in my opinion it's not a deal breaker. I definitely recommend this product, and the Babyliss diffuser to enhance your curls.
customer_reviews.author: redheadedtexan

customer_reviews.title: Buttons are not a problem
customer_reviews.text: I have read that some people don't like the location of the toggle switches. They are located on the handle. they are located where you can easily access them while drying your hair. I have only used it twice. Yes, I have hit the buttons a few times. But I want to be able to easily adjust the settings. I just have a small learning curve to become accustomed to the buttons. It has worked great. I don't regret my purchase. I love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: QTPi

customer_reviews.title: Happy to find this on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace exactly the same model that I'd used for about 7 years. When my old one died, I did some research, online and in stores, and decided that I was happy with my old model. I have fine hair that is easily tangled, but this dryer doesn't whip my hair around as much as some others that I've used (maybe because I'm so used to using it?) I was really pleased to be able to get it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: NewYorker001

customer_reviews.title: Fast dry - high heat
customer_reviews.text: Dries very fast and is very hot. I use the warm setting and it dries my whole head of hair in about 10 minutes. I the high heat settins is too hot for my hair and my daughter's and when we are done my hair feels very brittle. On the warm setting my hair is just fine. I would suggest using a blow dry hair serum especially when using a blow dryer with such can produce such high heat or it will dry out your hair. This is a good blow dryer if you use it properly - you can damage your hair when you start using professional strength products incorrectly.
customer_reviews.author: BrightBlue14

customer_reviews.title: Great Hair Dryer
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift I picked out myself & I LOVE IT! Powerful, lightweight & quick drying! Thick course hair dries evenly & within 8-10 minutes. (1/2 my previous drying time)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Good blow dryer, but bad customer service...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this blow dryer for just over a year and it has been great! However, the filter cover recently broke. I called the BaByliss customer service to purchase a replacement, but they don’t sell the part I need. The blow dryer is still under warranty, so they will replace it, but I have to pay shipping both ways and it’s going to take nearly a month. I can’t go that long without a blow dryer, so I guess I’ll have to buy a new one...a different brand with better customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love this hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: Love this dryer. Previous dryer was the same exactly but the filter cover broke so I had to replace the whole dryer. Which parts are available.
customer_reviews.author: Pam H.

customer_reviews.title: Great dryer, 1 problem.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised the dryer is light and comfortable to the touch. 1 Problem, the Cool button is located right where you grip the dryer to hold it. So you keep turning on the cool feature when you don't want it. Otherwise use and performance is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbee Nall

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye coarse hair, hello Baby Bliss
customer_reviews.text: I have very thick coarse hair. Have tried every product and straightener out there. My dryer died while on vacation and I borrowed my sister in law's Baby Bliss. wow! It dried my hair so fast but the best part? My hair was shiny and felt silky. Like it does after straightening at a salon. No more flat iron for me. This is a great product for stubborn coarse hair that won't dry or shine. I don't know how they do it but this dryer is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: G. Lalli

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 year before poofing into smoke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dryer in 2014. Sadly today, it just blew on me. Good new is all I got was a puff of smoke and it shut off, never to work again, no fire like all my last dryers! If you want a great dryer (although some cracking of paint after use) this is the one. 4 years is pretty amazing for a daily use dryer.
customer_reviews.author: OZ

customer_reviews.title: Best hair dryer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this hair dryer. Barely have to use a flat iron now! After about a year, the dryer just stopped. I was devastated. Called about the warranty and it was completely replaced (quickly too). I am a BIG fan of this hair dryer and the brand ConAir for replacing it so quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Worth the money. This is my second one - the first I gave to my sister because she was still using and "OTC" $14 deal from target. this is a great dryer, compact enough to travel well and the settings are easy to use. Gets my hair dry fast with just the right amount of heat and blow. It used to be $40 on Amazon, but the price recently went up for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine J Murphy

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this hairdryer on May 22, 2017 and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hairdryer on May 22, 2017 and two of the small plastic tabs on the inside of the back vent cover broke and the cover will not stay on. I currently have it duck taped on. Where can i get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: shoptilludrop

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Drys hair fast. Light weight. Love the way the hair feels after. Good to your hair. Moderate Cons: Yeah, you do hit the controls alot up front, but you get used to it, and you choose to 'get over it' cause the dryer is the best I have ever owned. Also, the black air flow nozzle does pop off, but you get used to holding the dryer far enough away from your head OR you super glue the nozzle to the dryer. Either way, you figure it out. RECOMMENDATION: I would buy it again. Ooops, I did. I bought a red one for home and a white one for travel!
customer_reviews.author: A. K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not as powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Babylis hairdryer. I had my previous dryer for several years and loved it,so when it came time to purchase a new one (I dropped my old dryer one too many times) I knew exactly what I wanted. This hairdryer is relatively quiet, has switches that are easy to operate when I'm folded in half trying to dry my hair, and has excellent power. The cool button works well to set your style. My only quibble is that it does feel slightly less powerful than the older model, but as I said that is slight.
customer_reviews.author: CD Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far. Had it a few weeks, people noticed the first day that my hair looked smoother and more shiny. I used to have to use a flat iron on the top of my hair to control the frizz, but I don't have to use one at all after drying with this dryer. And it does not take away body or volume, which is a huge plus. I was worried about flat hair with this because there's so much air force, but I still have lots of body. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sat825

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but... too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy to hold dryer, where the buttons are indeed in the wrong place - you continually change settings without trying. It does the job, but whether it's worth the price is questionable. Will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: tnypco

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected- still frizzy
customer_reviews.text: When I visit my hair dresser she always dry's my hair perfectly and she told me it was because of the dryer. She has a different brand dryer. I have a fine frizzy type hair and I wanted that salon look from home every day so I started shopping around. I bought this dryer because of the other reviews. I was sadly disappointed because my hair turned out the same as it did with my dryer from target. The price was really good so I can't complain, but if I want salon quality hair every day I might have to spend the big bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Onaroll 619

customer_reviews.title: Great dryer, poor filter design
customer_reviews.text: Love the way it makes my hair look and feel, but the design on the filter is poor. The piece that secures the filter to the dryer broker after 5 months, and I had to use a rubber band to hold it in place. Then, the filter dropped to the floor one day, and a third of it broke off, leaving the screen edges exposed. Ouch. Still, I got a sold two years of use out of it. I'll be purchasing another Babyliss, but not this model.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca67

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced. Get a drugstore dryer - or a better brand.
customer_reviews.text: Works. But not any better than a standard drugstore dryer. The handle is literally peeling and flaking off in sticky clumps. The screen on the back popped off and broke, and the grate is impossible to clean. Replacing.
customer_reviews.author: TKV

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down drying time.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has some serious power. Gets my hair dry in way less time than my old Chi dryer. The red finish is starting to crackle after a few months. I'm not sure if it is melting or what is going on, but it doesn't come off on my hands. Plus, I didn't buy it to look at it, I bought it to dry my hair. So, it does its job and does it well despite the cosmetic flaw.
customer_reviews.author: M. LeighTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 year 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hair dryer 1 year 9 months ago and it just smoked and caused the smoke detectors in the house to go off. I'm glad my smoke detectors work but this hair dryer should have lasted longer for the price. Also, the red finish on the hair dryer wears off over time where you hold it. The place where you hold it is now a pinkish color. I'm shopping for a new hair dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Mom

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Effective
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality blowdryer. I have such a difficult time with my hair and this helps me a lot. At first I tried drying my thin, medium-length hair on the warm+low setting. It took a long time, too long for me. So I switched up to the warm+high setting and my hair dried in no time! It's a lot quieter than cheap-o dryers, which is all I have ever had. I don't notice any difference in shine, it doesn't make my hair phenomenal. What I notice is that it's quieter and that it takes a lot less time to dry my hair.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Just giid
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Babyliss Pro. The first one crapoed out on me after a couple years, and was the best hairblower I’ve ever had so bought it again. Good luck, hope you like it too!
customer_reviews.author: Jan, Ft Myers

customer_reviews.title: Love this hairdryer
customer_reviews.text: After having the Super Solano on my wish list for years and finally ordering it from Amazon, I quickly returned it because it was too much air and not enough heat, leaving my rather thick hair in knots after each drying session. I ordered this one to replace it for nearly half the price and LOVE it. It's the perfect amount of air (not as much as the Super Solano) with just the right amount of heat on the high setting (and there are lower options if you find that too hot). I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

product_meta.title: BaBylissPRO Tourmaline Titanium 3000 Dryer
product_meta.description:
The BaBylissPRO Tourmaline Titanium 3000 blow dryer has a rubberized finish & comfort grip to help reduce stress on the hand & wrist. Far infra-red heat & ionic technology mean faster drying & styling. Featuring 6 heat/speed settings, a cold shot button & a 9' long cord, this hair dryer is a professional favorite. This 1900 watt dryer emits millions of ions for extra shine. Great for all hair types including think/coarse hair.

BRAND STORY
BaBylissPRO is the world’s leading producer of innovative, high-performance professional styling tools. Chosen by hairdressers, barbers, and clients everywhere, BabylissPRO styling tools are versatile and engineered to last.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
